Ecclesiasticus *__16.1: Rejoice not in ungodly children, if they be multiplied: neither be delighted in them, if the fear of God be not with them.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.2: Trust not to their life, and respect not their labours.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.3: For better is one that feareth God, than a thousand ungodly children.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.4: And it is better to die without children, than to leave ungodly children.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.5: By one that is wise a country shall be inhabited, the tribe of the ungodly shall become desolate.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.6: Many such things hath my eyes seen, and greater things than these my ear hath heard.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.7: In the congregation of sinners a fire shall be kindled, and in an unbelieving nation wrath shall dame out.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.8: The ancient giants did not obtain pardon for their sins, who were destroyed trusting to their own strength:
Ecclesiasticus *__16.9: And he spared not the place where Lot sojourned, but abhorred them for the pride of their word.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.10: He had not pity on them, destroying the whole nation that extolled themselves in their sins.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.11: So did he with the <u>six hundred thousand footmen</u>, who were gathered together in the hardness of their heart: and if one had been stiffnecked, it is a wonder if he had escaped unpunished:
Ecclesiasticus *__16.12: For mercy and wrath are with him. He is mighty to forgive, and to pour out indignation:
Ecclesiasticus *__16.13: According as his mercy is, so his correction judgeth a man according to his works.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.14: The sinner shall not escape in his rapines, and the patience of him that sheweth mercy shall not be put off.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.15: All mercy shall make a place for every man according to the merit of his works, and according to the wisdom of his sojournment.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.16: Say not: I shall be hidden from God. and who shall remember me from on high?
Ecclesiasticus *__16.17: In such a multitude I shall not be known: for what is my soul in such an immense creation?
Ecclesiasticus *__16.18: Behold the heaven, and the heavens of heavens, the deep, and all the earth, and the things that are in them, shall be moved in his sight,
Ecclesiasticus *__16.19: The mountains also, and the hills, and the foundations of the earth: when God shall look upon them, they shall be shaken with trembling.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.20: And in all these things the heart is senseless: and every heart is understood by him:
Ecclesiasticus *__16.21: And his ways who shall understand, and the storm, which no eye of man see?
Ecclesiasticus *__16.22: For many of his works are hidden: hut the works of his justice who shall declare? or who shall endure? for the testament is far from some, and the examination of all is in the end.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.23: He that wanteth understanding thinketh vain things: and the foolish, and erring man, thinketh foolish things.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.24: Hearken to me, my son, and learn the discipline of understanding, and attend to my words in thy heart.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.25: And I will shew forth good doctrine in equity, and will seek to declare wisdom: and attend to my words in thy heart, whilst with equity of spirit I tell thee the virtues that God hath put upon his works from the beginning, and I shew forth in truth his knowledge.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.26: The works of God are done in judgment from the beginning, and from the making of them he distinguished their parts, and their beginnings in their generations.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.27: He beautified their works for ever, they have neither hungered, nor laboured, and they have not ceased from their works.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.28: Nor shall any of them straiten his neighbour at any time.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.29: Be not thou incredulous to his word.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.30: After this God looked upon the earth, and filled it with his goods.
Ecclesiasticus *__16.31: The soul of every living thing hath <u>shewn forth</u> before the face thereof, and into it they return again.
